result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey M Callewaert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Alter Identification AMENDED FROM Forgery-Uttering, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(3)(b).
  • Obtain Prescription Drug w/ Fraud AMENDED FROM Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.  Wean off of current narcotic prescriptions.  Once weaned, defendant is not to have any narcotic drugs of any kind, even with a prescription.

Defendant must attend 5 self-help meetings per week and provide signed proof of attendance.Defendant is to sign medical release to allow agent access to medical and prescription records.  Agent is to approve all prescriptions.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Defendant is being evaluated for Drug Court.
  Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2014 at 09:00 am.
ZCI

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  ***ALSO $2,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND***   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
